title: Make Rose Day page text clearly visible with stronger pink text colors

requirements.text: Update the Rose Day theme text color tokens to use a stronger, more saturated pink for primary readable text (not a near-white tint), so the on-page copy is clearly visible against the current red/pink background and gradient overlays.

quotes: nah nah nah, ain't visible... get it pink itself

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/index.css`, adjust the text-related theme tokens used for readability (e.g., `--rose-text`, `--rose-medium`, and/or `--foreground` if needed) so they render as clearly pink text with noticeably higher visibility than the current styling.
The updated text colors remain within the existing romantic red/pink palette (no blue/purple shift).
Text remains readable across the full-page background image plus gradient overlay (no sections where text blends into the background).

requirements.text: Ensure the most prominent text elements on the Rose Day page use the updated stronger-pink readable text styling consistently, including the header greeting, date, subtitle, message card body text, and footer text.

quotes: nah nah nah, ain't visible... get it pink itself

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/pages/RoseDayPage.tsx`, the header greeting paragraph, the date line, and the subtitle line visually appear in the new stronger-pink readable color (not washed out / near-white).
In the message card, the paragraph text and the ‘Love • Romance • Forever’ labels remain clearly legible and aligned with the updated pink text styling.
Footer text remains readable (including the © line and the caffeine.ai link) without relying on very low-opacity text colors that reduce visibility.

constraints: Do not edit any frontend immutable paths (e.g., `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts[x]`, `frontend/src/components/ui`).
Keep the app as a single-page Rose Day landing page; no backend changes are required.
nonGoals: Do not change the user-provided greeting message content or its line breaks/emoji.
Do not change or regenerate existing image assets as part of this request.
Do not add new sections or features beyond improving text visibility and color.
